summary: Patricia M. Orr was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list her name, position, salary, and employment dates. She appears in payroll certifications from April 1978 to January 1979, indicating her employment spanned at least this period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll suggests she held an administrative or support position.
significance: Patricia M. Orr's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the available documents do not detail her specific contributions, her presence on the committee's payroll indicates her involvement in its operations during the investigation into the JFK assassination.
